title: 109_s2163
content: The "Armed Forces Education Benefits Improvement Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes adjustments and annual determination of educational assistance under the Montgomery GI Bill for active duty members. The "Armed Forces Education Benefits Improvement Act" amends Section 3015 of title 38, United States Code, regarding educational assistance under the Montgomery GI Bill for active duty members. It includes adjustments to monthly amounts for approved full-time education programs. The "Armed Forces Education Benefits Improvement Act" adjusts monthly amounts for approved full-time education programs under the Montgomery GI Bill for active duty members. The amendments include specific calculations for monthly amounts in fiscal years 2005 and beyond, with an effective date after the enactment of the Act. The "Armed Forces Education Benefits Improvement Act" adjusts monthly amounts for approved full-time education programs under the Montgomery GI Bill for active duty members, with specific calculations for fiscal years 2005 and beyond. The Ronald W. Reagan National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2005 enhances educational benefits for Selected Reserve members returning from tours in Iraq and Afghanistan. The Secretary of Defense must collaborate with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to ensure timely access to these benefits. Additionally, a study on the impact of the Montgomery GI bill is required. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will conduct a study on the effect of Montgomery GI bill educational benefits on veterans' readjustment. A report on the enhanced benefits must be submitted within 18 months. The Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit a report on the results of studies conducted on enhanced benefits to relevant committees within 18 months. SEC. 4. Adjustment and annual determination of educational assistance under the Montgomery GI Bill for certain members of the Selected Reserve. Increase in Rates for educational assistance under the Montgomery GI Bill for certain members of the Selected Reserve, with specific monthly amounts based on program of education pursued and fiscal year. The Montgomery GI Bill provides specific monthly amounts for educational assistance to certain members of the Selected Reserve based on the program of education pursued and fiscal year. The monthly amounts increase annually based on a percentage calculated under paragraph (2). The Montgomery GI Bill provides monthly educational assistance to Selected Reserve members based on program and fiscal year. Amendments to the bill include specifying the effective date for changes related to college tuition and fees. SEC. 5. Opportunity for certain active-duty personnel to enroll under the Montgomery GI Bill. Section 3018D allows qualified active-duty personnel to enroll for educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code, within a 1-year period from enactment. The Secretary of each military department will establish procedures for this enrollment. Qualified active-duty personnel can enroll for educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code within a 1-year period from enactment if they meet specific requirements, including serving on active duty without a break since before July 1, 1985. Qualified active-duty personnel can receive educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code if they meet specific requirements, including completing a secondary school diploma or equivalent, or earning 12 semester hours towards a college degree. Upon discharge, they must receive an honorable discharge. The individual's basic pay will be reduced until it reaches $1,200 to receive basic educational assistance. Qualified active-duty personnel can receive educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code if they meet specific requirements, including completing a secondary school diploma or equivalent, or earning 12 semester hours towards a college degree. Upon discharge, they must receive an honorable discharge. The individual's basic pay will be reduced until it reaches $1,200 to receive basic educational assistance. The Secretary concerned shall provide for an 18-month period for the qualified individual to make payments. The qualified individual has 18 months to pay the amount due to the Secretary after making an election. The period of eligibility for basic educational assistance remains unchanged. No educational assistance allowance will be paid until the applicable amount is collected or retired pay is reduced. The Secretary, with the Secretary of Defense, will notify individuals of the opportunity to elect basic educational assistance. Amendments are made to section 3017(b)(1) of title 38, United States Code. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 30 of title 38. Amendments are made to section 3018D, allowing certain active-duty personnel to enroll in educational assistance programs.
